ðŸš€ FaceEnhance | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Improving facial fidelity in AI-generated images.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Enhances facial consistency and quality in AI-generated images â€¢ Preserves original image's background, lighting, and composition â€¢ ComfyUI workflows for face enhancement and embedding distance calculation â€¢ Gradio demo for interactive face enhancement
ðŸ“– Summary: The FaceEnhance repository provides tools and workflows for enhancing faces in AI-generated images. It focuses on improving facial consistency and quality while preserving the original image's context. The repository includes ComfyUI workflows and a Gradio demo for interactive use.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ cap | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Protecting APIs from bots, preventing spam on forms, blocking automated login attempts, and securing free-tier abuse.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Lightweight CAPTCHA alternative â€¢ SHA-256 proof-of-work â€¢ Small JavaScript widget â€¢ Zero-dependency server component â€¢ Optional server-side solver
ðŸ“– Summary: Cap is a lightweight, modern CAPTCHA alternative that uses SHA-256 proof-of-work to protect against bots and abuse. It offers a small JavaScript widget for client-side challenges and a zero-dependency server component for validation. Cap can be deployed in various environments, including standalone mode with Docker, and is designed to be a privacy-focused and customizable replacement for traditional CAPTCHAs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ winapps | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Running Windows applications seamlessly within a Linux environment.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Runs Windows applications in Linux (Ubuntu/Fedora) â€¢ Integrates Windows apps into GNOME/KDE desktop environments â€¢ Provides Nautilus integration for opening files with Windows apps â€¢ Supports any installed application on the system
ðŸ“– Summary: WinApps allows users to run Windows applications on Linux systems as if they were native applications. It achieves this by running a Windows RDP server in a background VM and creating shortcuts for installed applications, integrating them into the GNOME/KDE desktop. It also provides Nautilus integration for opening files with Windows applications and supports any installed application on the system.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ bore | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Exposing local ports to a remote server, bypassing NAT firewalls for development and testing purposes.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ TCP Tunneling â€¢ Local Port Forwarding â€¢ Self-Hosting â€¢ Simple Installation â€¢ Minimal Dependencies
ðŸ“– Summary: Bore is a CLI tool that creates TCP tunnels to localhost, enabling users to expose local ports to the internet. It's designed for simple installation, self-hosting, and efficient TCP traffic forwarding. Bore allows developers to easily share and test local applications without complex configurations.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ twice | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To promote mindful social media usage by prompting users to think twice before visiting social media sites.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Displays a gentle reminder when visiting social media sites â€¢ Promotes mindful internet usage â€¢ Helps reduce impulsive social media checking
ðŸ“– Summary: The 'Twice' Chrome extension helps users be more mindful of their social media habits. It displays a reminder when a user attempts to visit a social media site, encouraging them to pause and reflect on their intention, promoting more intentional browsing habits.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ shrub | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Simulating a bonsai plant ecosystem within a terminal environment.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ TUI pet plant simulator â€¢ Big scrolly worlds â€¢ Water, wind, dirt simulation â€¢ Plant growth and reproduction â€¢ Pollen and seed dispersal
ðŸ“– Summary: Shrub is a terminal-based bonsai plant simulation game written in C. It simulates a small ecosystem with plants, water, wind, dirt, pollen, and seeds, allowing users to observe plant growth, reproduction, and death within a cellular automata-driven world.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ maigret | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Collecting a dossier on a person by username from thousands of sites without requiring API keys.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Profile page parsing and information extraction â€¢ Recursive search by usernames and IDs â€¢ Search by tags (site categories, countries)
ðŸ“– Summary: Maigret is an OSINT tool that allows users to gather information about individuals based on their usernames across a vast number of websites. It parses profile pages, extracts personal information, and performs recursive searches to uncover related accounts and data. The tool supports searching by tags, detects censorship and captchas, and includes features for request retries and checking Tor, I2P, and domain sites.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
